channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'A very, very small number' of teens receive gender-affirming care, study finds
item.description: A new analysis of private insurance claims data finds less than 0.1% of youth accessed puberty blockers or hormones for gender transition. This small ...

item.title: U.S. Steel sues to salvage its sale to Japan's Nippon Steel
item.description: U.S. Steel and its would-be Japanese suitor filed twin lawsuits Monday to defend their $15 billion merger. President Biden issued an order on Friday t...

item.title: Congestion pricing begins in New York City
item.description: New York City's first-in-the-nation congestion pricing plan has gone into effect. CBS News reporter Elijah Westbrook has more.

item.title: Nippon and US Steel sue government over blocked deal
item.description: The companies allege President Biden "ignored the rule of law to gain favor" with trade unions.

item.title: Polar vortex keeps a huge swath of the US in its icy grip
item.description: A huge swath of the U.S. is being blasted by ice, snow and wind, as the polar vortex that dipped south over the weekend is keeping an area stretching ...

item.title: "The Brutalist," "Emilia Perez" and Demi Moore among Golden Globe winners
item.description: Demi Moore accepted her first-ever Golden Globe award for her role in the horror movie "The Substance." Other big winners include the musical "Emilia ...

item.title: Nicolas Sarkozy goes on trial over alleged Gaddafi election funding
item.description: If found guilty of taking illicit funds from the late Libyan leader, Sarkozy faces up to 10 years in prison.

item.title: Canada's Justin Trudeau says he will resign as party leader and prime minister
item.description: Trudeau's decision after almost a decade in power sets the stage for a succession fight to select a new prime minister.

item.title: Photos: See the impact a major winter storm is having on U.S.
item.description: Winter storm warnings have ben declared from Illinois to New Jersey. And some areas will get a lot of snow. They will also get freezing rain and ice, ...

item.title: Five missing Kenyan youths freed amid uproar over abductions
item.description: More than 80 young Kenyans have gone missing in recent months, with many blaming the security forces.

item.title: Biden is traveling to New Orleans following the French Quarter attack that killed 14 and injured 30
Charlie Hebdo marks decade since gun attack with special issue
item.description: The French satirical magazine wants to show its cause is still kicking, writes the BBC's Hugh Schofield.

item.title: Winter storm brings power outages, leaves utilities customers in the dark
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of households across southern and eastern U.S. states were without power Monday.

item.title: 'It's the beginning': Demi Moore wins her first major acting award at the Golden Globes
item.description: Moore, 62, won the Golden Globe for her starring role in The Substance. She said the film is the start of a new chapter in her career: "It's just this...

item.title: Harris to certify Trump's US election win, four years after Capitol riot
item.description: Monday's session in Congress comes on the anniversary of violence by Trump supporters on 6 January 2021.

item.title: U.S. Steel, Nippon file lawsuits over Biden's block of merger
item.description: U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel filed lawsuits Monday over President Joe Biden's blockage of the Japanese company's proposed takeover of its Pittsburgh-ba...

item.title: What proof must credit card debt collectors provide for a debt?
item.description: Debt collectors must provide proof that a debt is valid. Otherwise, they have to stop their collection efforts.

item.title: Trump’s lawyers ask judge to halt Friday’s hush money case sentencing while they appeal to block it
